## 2. Expansion and diversification into allied sectors by leveraging existing capabilities
We intend to broaden our overhead-conductor portfolio by adding copper-alloy conductors specifically engineered for railway applications.

We also plan to diversify our power-cable portfolio by pursuing opportunities in wind, EV, locomotives and marine sectors. We have recently introduced MVCC cables for solar sector and have started manufacturing solar cables at our manufacturing facility situated at Haridwar and intend to manufacture and E-beam irradiated cable. According to the CRISIL Report, the demand for cables in the renewables sector, specifically in solar and wind applications, has experienced noteworthy growth in tandem with the global shift towards sustainable energy sources. Due to increased focus on renewable energy by corporate and government alike, the solar as well as wind industry are growing at remarkable pace. Solar power transmission relies on essential components, with solar cables playing a crucial role. These specialized cables are engineered to withstand harsh weather, UV exposure, and high electrical loads, solar cables provide flexibility, durability, and reliability in advancing solar power system development and helps in connecting solar panels to the electrical grid, facilitating the widespread integration of solar power. The market size of solar cables has risen from ₹ 5.9 billion in Fiscal 2019 to ₹ 27.5 billion in Fiscal 2025, and it is anticipated to reach approximately ₹ 50 billion to 55 billion by Fiscal 2030, reflecting a CAGR of approximately 13% to 17% between Fiscal 2025 and Fiscal 2030. CRISIL Report also expects a surge in solar power capacity additions, reaching 140 GW to 160 GW from Fiscal 2026 to Fiscal 2030 significantly surpassing the 78 GW added between Fiscal 2020 and 2025. (Source: CRISIL Report)

We will also target the data center and process industry verticals within the industrial sector. We plan to introduce intelliSenset cables as this will cater to the requirements of data centers and process industries, providing advanced monitoring capabilities, high power transmission efficiency, and enhanced reliability. We also intend to introduce e-beam low voltage flexible cables for locomotives and marine (both commercial and defence).
## 3. Product diversification with a focus on premium offering

We will leverage our R&D capabilities coupled with our manufacturing expertise and experience in Power T&D industry to introduce value-added products which will enable us to strengthen our competitive edge, improve margins and deliver complex, customer-specific solutions. In the past, we transitioned from manufacturing of standard conductors to high-performance, application-specific solutions leveraging ACCC and GAP technology. For example, we have introduced ACCC Casablanca (132 kV), ACCC Drake (220 kV) and ACCC Hamburg (220/400 kV) for reconductoring projects to raise line capacity without new towers, introduced GAP 232 (132 kV), GAP 504 (220 kV), GAP 616 (400 kV) and GAP 568 (400 kV) to enable live-line re-tensioning and extend asset life, rolled out ACSS 479, ACSS 487 and ACSS 25.8 for new lines and TBCB opportunities to provide high-temperature, low-sag performance and reduce right-of-way needs, engineered ACCC Ganga and ACCC Brahmaputra for river crossings spanning 1.2 kilometers and 3 kilometers, introduced ACCC Daman (66 kV) and ACCC Copenhagen (33 kV) for urban distribution corridors where space is limited, and introduced ECO and ECO Max conductors for renewable-energy evacuation to support high-capacity solar and wind farm connections.
